If.ReportItem:
Study Title: KFLA Centre for Healthy Aging: The AVOID Frailty program for Healthy Aging

Name of Principal investigator: Dr John Muscedere
Name of Sponsor/Funder: Canadian Frailty Network

As a participant of the AVOID Frailty Program for Healthy Aging, you are invited to take part in an associated research study. The purpose of this study is to evaluate how well the program is supporting you in your development of healthy behaviours. If you agree to take part, you will be asked to complete an online survey when you sign up for the program, and the same survey every six months after. The survey should take you about 20 minutes to complete. It will ask you about: some of your background information to help us adjust the program in its accessibility; your health status, quality of life and curiosity around healthy behaviours to help us track how effective the program has been. Much of this survey will provide information to personalize your program so that it is supportive based on frailty indicators and behavioural risks, but we also want to make sure that you are benefiting and if not, want to adjust the program to ensure it is resulting in positive health outcomes for all participants.

In addition to the survey, you may be contacted by email by Kyle Plumb to invite you to an interview to discuss your usage and experience with the platform. This interview will take approximately 30 minutes to complete and will be conducted in person. Participants are selected based on their level of program usage ‚Äì we are interested in both the facilitators and barriers to participant activity and thus seek to understand why you are either using the program often, or rarely. You may opt-out of this portion of the study at any time via email response. No identifiable information will be sought during the interview as the information sought is regarding program usage rather than outcomes. The interview will be recorded and transcribed by the research team where your name will be replaced with an identification number. Upon transcription, the audio will be deleted and the transcribed interviews will be stored in a secure computer drive in a locked cabinet.

There is a minimal risk that you may experience discomfort if you feel that the questions are too personal or refer to sensitive issues. The questions are not meant to be personal but if you do not feel comfortable answering a question, you do not need to answer it. No identifiable information will be generated. As a user of this program, you may or may not see direct benefits from this study, but the study results will add to the body of literature about how to support people to undertake healthy behaviours and the community will benefit from the information you provide that will potentially enhance the quality of the program for future users. We also plan to publish the results of this study in academic journals and present them at conferences. You will not be paid for joining this study but the program is free for you to enjoy. You will be provided with any new information that may be relevant to your continuing from study participation.

Participation is voluntary. You don‚Äôt have to answer any questions you don‚Äôt want to. You can stop participating at any time without impact on your ability to use the AVOID Frailty Program or any other negative impacts. If you exit out of the survey before completion (close your laptop or phone) your progress will be saved for you to complete at a later time. You may withdraw from the study up until March 1, 2025 by contacting me at kyle@cfn-nce.ca. Your data cannot be withdrawn after the submission of the anonymous survey.

Your confidentiality will be protected, to the extent permitted by applicable laws. We will do this by replacing your name with a study ID number in all study records. This data will be stored in an encrypted folder in a password protected computer that is kept in a locked file cabinet in the CFN office. The code file that links real names with pseudonyms and study ID numbers will be stored securely and separately from the data on an encrypted USB. We will keep your data securely for five years per Queen‚Äôs University Policy, after which the de-identified data will be destroyed. In the future, we may link data collected in this study with other sources of publicly or provincially collected data to better understanding aging in this region. Data which is not anonymous will not be shared with any other party and any linked data will be accessible by only the study investigators. The CFN research team consisting of Dr. Kyle Plumb -Project Manager, Dr. Jeanette Prorok Manager of Special Projects and Initiatives; and PI ‚Äì Dr. John Muscedere ‚Äì CFN‚Äôs Scientific Director will have sole access to the study data during its collection, use, analysis, dissemination, and disposal. The Queen‚Äôs University Health Sciences and Affiliated Teaching Hospitals Research Ethics Board (HSREB) may require access to your study-related records to monitor the ethical conduct of the research. HSREB is bound by confidentiality agreements concerning any personal information.

For ethics concerns please contact the Queen‚Äôs University Health Sciences and Affiliated Teaching Hospitals Research Ethics Board (HSREB) at 1-844-535-2988 (Toll free in North America) or hsreb@queensu.ca.

If you have any questions about the research, please contact me at kyle@cfn-nce.ca or 613-449-2140.

This Letter of Information provides you with the details to help you make an informed choice. All your questions should be answered to your satisfaction before you decide whether or not to participate in this research study. You have not waived any legal rights by consenting to participate in this study. This study has been reviewed for ethical compliance by the Queen‚Äôs University Health Sciences and Affiliated Teaching Hospitals Research Ethics Board. A copy of the LOI/CF will be kept by the Researcher.

By clicking below, I am verifying that: I have read the Letter of Information and I consent to participate in this research study:

NOTE: Please answer the questions in this section to the best of your ability. This is important information to help us understand who is using the program (and consequently, who isn't) so that we can make sure we are helping everyone who needs it. As more information is gathered, we will be able to personalize the experience for you and future users!

The Healthy Aging Assessment will take between 10 and 15 minutes to complete. You can log out at any time and your progress will be saved to complete later at your convenience.

ReportSection.Static:
<script type='text/javascript'>
                    function getScore(score){
                        if(score == "None"){return 0}
                        else if(score=="1"){return 1}
                        else if(score=="2"){return 2}
                        else if (score=="3-4"){return 3}
                        else if(score=="5-8"){return 4}
                        else{return 5}
                    }

                    function calculateInteractionScore(){
                        var score1 = $("input:radio[name='SelfAssessment_interact1_avoid']:checked").val()
                        var score2 = $("input:radio[name='SelfAssessment_interact2_avoid']:checked").val()
                        var score3 = $("input:radio[name='SelfAssessment_interact3_avoid']:checked").val()
                        var score4 = $("input:radio[name='SelfAssessment_interact4_avoid']:checked").val()
                        var score5 = $("input:radio[name='SelfAssessment_interact5_avoid']:checked").val()
                        var score6 = $("input:radio[name='SelfAssessment_interact6_avoid']:checked").val()
                        return getScore(score1) + getScore(score2) + getScore(score3) + getScore(score4) + getScore(score5) + getScore(score6)
                    }

                    $('span#interact_end').hide();
                    function specifyInteractEnd(){
                        if(calculateInteractionScore() < 12 ){
                            $('span#interact_end').show();
                        }
                        else{
                            $('span#interact_end').hide();
                        }
                    }
                    _.defer(specifyInteractEnd);
                    $("input:radio[name='SelfAssessment_interact1_avoid']").change(specifyInteractEnd);
                    $("input:radio[name='SelfAssessment_interact2_avoid']").change(specifyInteractEnd);
                    $("input:radio[name='SelfAssessment_interact3_avoid']").change(specifyInteractEnd);
                    $("input:radio[name='SelfAssessment_interact4_avoid']").change(specifyInteractEnd);
                    $("input:radio[name='SelfAssessment_interact5_avoid']").change(specifyInteractEnd);
                    $("input:radio[name='SelfAssessment_interact6_avoid']").change(specifyInteractEnd);

                    $('span#interact_end_specify').hide();
                    function specifyInteractOther(){
                        var flag = false;
                        $('input[name="SelfAssessment_interact_end[]"]:checked').each(function() {
                            if(this.value == "Other"){
                                flag = true;
                            }
                        });
                        if(flag){
                            $('span#interact_end_specify').show();
                        }
                        else{ 
                            $('span#interact_end_specify').hide();
                        }
                    }
                    _.defer(specifyInteractOther);
                    $("input:checkbox[name='SelfAssessment_interact_end[]']").change(specifyInteractOther);
            </script>

ReportSection.name: Healthy Aging Asset Index

ReportItem.labels: I am active, energetic, and exercise regularly| I am well, but only occasionally active. I can manage finances/transportation/ heavy housework on my own.| My health conditions are well managed, but I am generally inactive. I may require advice on how to obtain support with finances/transportation/heavy housework.| I am more tired than I used to be, and have more troubles obtaining needed supports than before, but can still coordinate things myself.| I need physical or practical assistance with finances, transportation or heavy housework.| I need assistance with out of home activities, require help with bathing or medications, or struggle with stairs.| I need help with all of my personal care.| I am completely dependent for all of my personal care.| I am terminally ill and at the end of my life.

ReportSection.ReportItem:
Please read the following statements and select the one that best describes you.

{$item}
ReportSection.Static:
Welcome to the Healthy Aging Asset Index (HAAI) self-assessment! Our goal is to understand what makes you feel strong and supported, and where you might need extra help for healthy aging.

The assessment looks at different areas that affect your well-being, like your physical and mental health, social connections, and the safety of your environment.

Here's how to complete the assessment:

  • Take your time: Read each question carefully and think about your answer. There are no right or wrong responses ‚Äì we want to know what's true for you.
  • Answer honestly: Your honest answers will help us understand your unique needs for better support. For each question, select the answer that best applies to you and most accurately reflects your life and feelings right now.
  • Save your progress: If you need a break, no problem! You can save your progress and come back later using the same device and browser.
  • Receive insights: After finishing the assessment, you will get results that highlight any areas where you might need extra support, as well as referrals to community programs and/or resources based on your specific needs.
  • Should you have any questions or need assistance along the way, please click the "help" button. Let's get started!

ReportItem.labels: I make time 5-7 days a week to be physically active/exercise.| I am active to complete shopping, errands, banking or personal care.| I am only active within my home.| I am unable to be out of my bed or chair.

ReportSection.ReportItem:
Physical Health

How would you describe your physical activity/exercise level?

{$item}

Is your health negatively affecting your life activities?

{$item}

ReportItem.labels: My level of health mildly affects my activities, but is reasonably managed.| My level of health is interfering with my activities and requires the help of health experts.| My level of health is severely limiting my activities and requires complex help.

ReportSection.ReportItem:
How significantly is your life affected by your physical health?

{$item}

Do you take medications or supplements?

{$item}

ReportItem.labels: I take 5 or less medications and know what each one does.| I take 5 or less medications and don't remember what each one does.| I take more than 5 medications and don't know exactly how to take them properly.| I take more than 5 medications and they include sleeping or pain pills.

ReportSection.ReportItem:
How many medications do you take, and are you comfortable with them?

{$item}

ReportItem.labels: I see my primary care provider for all of my care needs.| I have a primary care provider, but I go to a walk in clinic or ER for some primary care.| I seldom see a primary care provider, and go to walk in or ER instead for my primary care.| I have no primary care provider, and get any required care at walk in or ER.

ReportSection.ReportItem:
Personal Well-being

Access to a primary care provider (someone who knows you and helps with your day-to-day care) can help keep people healthy, well, and prevent hospitalization.

Do you have good access to a primary care provider, so you can access the non-emergency care that you need?

{$item}

ReportItem.labels: My primary care provider speaks the same language as I do and we can understand each other.| My primary care provider has some awareness of my language and we sometime struggle to understand each other.| My primary care provider does not speak my language and uses a professional interpreter to communicate.| My primary care provider does not speak my language. My family translates when they can be there.

ReportSection.ReportItem:
Are you able to talk with your primary care provider in your own language, and can you understand each other?

{$item}

ReportItem.labels: I know who I am, and have a natural sense of belonging.| I am able to reach out to supports when I need support to feel that I belong.| I usually don't reach out to these types of supports to feel that I belong, only if there is a crisis.| I have no supports and do not feel that I belong.

ReportSection.ReportItem:
Many people find identity and a sense of belonging in things like extended family, religion, culture, or gender supports.

Are you able to connect to supports in these areas that give you a sense of belonging?

{$item}

ReportItem.labels: I have no mental health concerns OR if I do they do not impact my life and wellness.| I have mild mental health issues and they impact my life or wellness occasionally.| I have moderate mental health issues which impact my life and wellness most of the time.| I have severe mental health issues which are causing danger to me or to others.

ReportSection.ReportItem:
Mental Health

Do you have any mental health concerns that affect your life and wellness?

{$item}

ReportItem.labels: I have no mental health issues.| I have mild mental health issues and I am easily able to manage them myself.| I have moderate mental health issues which need the help of more than one professional.| I have significant mental health issues, and need urgent support from professionals.

ReportSection.ReportItem:
How do you take care of your mental health?

{$item}

ReportItem.labels: I don't use substances OR they don't affect my wellness.| I use substances occasionally, but they are not impacting my wellness.| I use substances to help me cope regularly, and they sometimes impact my wellness.| I use too many substances, and they are causing risk to me and interfering with my life.

ReportSection.ReportItem:
Do you ever feel that your use of substances like alcohol, drugs, or marijuana has affected your wellness?

{$item}

ReportItem.labels: I take care of my own daily activities, and do not need any help.| I have help with my daily activities from a friend, neighbour, family member, or caregiver.| I have help with my daily activities, but my friend, neighbour, family member, or caregiver is overwhelmed.| I need help with daily activities, but I have no one available to help me.

ReportSection.ReportItem:
Social Support

Do you rely on anyone to help you with daily activities, like a friend, neighbour, family member, or caregiver?

{$item}

ReportItem.labels: I am confident managing my finances without any help.| I am confident managing my own finances, and I have someone to help me if needed.| I am not confident managing my own finances, but I do have someone to help me.| I am not confident managing my finances, and I have no one to help me.

ReportSection.ReportItem:
Are you confident managing your own finances?

{$item}

ReportItem.labels: I don't require help from any organizations, programs, or workers.| I have help from organizations, programs, or workers, but I'm uncertain if I can trust them all.| I have help from one organization, program, or worker that I trust, and others which I don't trust.| I need help from an organization, program, or worker, but don't have any I can trust.

ReportSection.ReportItem:
Some individuals need to access support from social workers, community organizations or government programs.

Do you regularly access support from any organizations, programs or workers?

{$item}

ReportItem.labels: I can afford to live in my home, and my neighbourhood is safe. I want to stay there.| I struggle to afford my home. It might be temporary, but the neighbourhood is safe and I would like to stay there.| I have issues with the cost of my home, the safety of my neighbourhood, and I may not be able to stay there.| My neighbourhood is unsafe OR I have nowhere to live right now.

ReportSection.ReportItem:
Physical Environment

Do you have a safe, affordable place to live?

{$item}

ReportItem.labels: I have a secure income and I know exactly how much I will have in my wallet each month.| I have difficulty making ends meet in some months.| I have difficulty making ends meet most months.| I have difficulty making ends meet all of the time OR have no income.

ReportSection.ReportItem:
Is it hard to make ends meet each month with your current income?

{$item}

ReportItem.labels: I can drive and have a car OR am able to get myself where I need to go by public transit.| I depend on driving services to get where I need to go, such as Drive Happiness or taxis.| I depend on friends or family to drive me where I need to go.| I am unable to access transportation.

ReportSection.ReportItem:
How do you normally get to appointments or shopping?

{$item}

ReportItem.labels: My home space is maintained and uncluttered.| My home is cluttered or I have difficulty getting around in it because of my mobility needs.| My home has maintenance and mobility concerns.| My home has multiple safety hazards.

ReportSection.ReportItem:
Safety and Security

Is your home poorly maintained or cluttered?

{$item}

ReportItem.labels: No one in my life is causing me harm.| No one in my life is causing me emotional, financial or physical harm but some relationships are difficult.| Someone in my life is causing me emotional or financial harm.| Someone in my life is causing me physical harm.

ReportSection.ReportItem:
Is anyone in your life causing you harm (physical, emotional, financial)?

{$item}

ReportItem.labels: I am able to keep up with all of my home upkeep and personal tasks.| I am struggling with one of my home upkeep or personal tasks.| I am struggling with two of my home upkeep or personal tasks.| I am struggling with three or more of my home upkeep or personal tasks.

ReportSection.ReportItem:
How able are you to manage your home's upkeep and your personal tasks (bathing, cooking, laundry, cleaning)?

{$item}

ReportItem.labels: I am actively involved in my community.| I am involved but I have some barriers. For example, I may struggle with transportation to events.| I am not involved much with any community and I don't know how to get more involved.| I am not involved with my community and I'm not interested in being more involved.

ReportSection.ReportItem:
Social Engagement

Are you regularly involved in any communities, like a neighbourhood group, religious group, or a hobby?

{$item}

ReportItem.labels: I am currently involved with family, friends and volunteering/work.| I am not involved with one of these groups/activities.| I am not involved with two of these groups/activities.| I am not involved, or unable to be involved in any of these groups/activities.

ReportSection.ReportItem:
Are you involved with family, friends, and some kind of volunteering/work?

{$item}

ReportItem.labels: I am very ready to make life changes that improve my health.| I am willing to make changes but feel a bit unsure about the process.| I don't believe that changes are necessary right now, even though I'm not as healthy as I could be.| I think my health is just fine as it is and do not want to change anything now.

ReportSection.ReportItem:
How ready are you to make changes in your life to improve your overall health?

{$item}
